title: U.S. Economy Is Expected to Pick Up Speed After Delta-Driven Downturn
sub_head: Economists cut third-quarter growth estimates because of Covid-19 surge and supply constraints but expect recovery to regain momentum
body:
The Delta variant of Covid-19 appeared to temper economic growth this summer, but economists expect the recovery from the pandemic to reaccelerate as the virusâ€™s toll eases.
In recent weeks, many economists lowered their forecasts for third-quarter economic growth in large part because consumers slowed spending on meals out, hotels and airline tickets amid the spread of the highly contagious Delta variant. The Covid-19 surge also complicated office and school reopenings, turning what had been expected to be a September boom into a downturn.
